quiz.title: Verbal Ability Beginner to Intermediate Quiz

questions.text: Choose the synonym for 'big'.
questions.explanation: 'Big' means having a large size, and 'large' is a synonym with a similar meaning.

questions.text: Choose the antonym for 'happy'.
questions.explanation: 'Happy' means experiencing joy, and 'sad' is its opposite, meaning sorrowful.

questions.text: Complete the analogy: Big is to small as tall is to ____.
questions.explanation: Big and small are opposites in size, as are tall and short in height.

questions.text: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: She was ____ tired after the long journey.
questions.explanation: 'Very' is an adverb that correctly modifies the adjective 'tired' to indicate degree.

questions.text: Identify the error in the sentence: He go to school every day.
questions.explanation: The verb 'go' should be 'goes' to agree with the singular subject 'He' in present tense.

questions.text: What is the meaning of the word 'benevolent'?
questions.explanation: 'Benevolent' means showing kindness and generosity, often with a desire to help others.

questions.text: Choose the synonym for 'quick'.
questions.explanation: 'Quick' means moving or done rapidly, and 'fast' is a synonym with a similar meaning.

questions.text: Choose the antonym for 'generous'.
questions.explanation: 'Generous' means giving freely, and 'selfish' is its opposite, meaning concerned only with oneself.

questions.text: Complete the analogy: Pen is to write as knife is to ____.
questions.explanation: A pen is used to write, and a knife is used to cut, following the tool-to-action relationship.

questions.text: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: They ____ to the park yesterday.
questions.explanation: 'Went' is the past tense of 'go,' correctly fitting the sentence's past time frame.

questions.text: Identify the error in the sentence: The book are on the table.
questions.explanation: The verb 'are' should be 'is' to agree with the singular subject 'book'.

questions.text: What is the meaning of the word 'cautious'?
questions.explanation: 'Cautious' means being careful to avoid risks, indicating alertness and prudence.

questions.text: Choose the synonym for 'beautiful'.
questions.explanation: 'Beautiful' means pleasing to the senses, and 'lovely' is a synonym with a similar meaning.

questions.text: Choose the antonym for 'difficult'.
questions.explanation: 'Difficult' means requiring effort, and 'easy' is its opposite, meaning not hard.

questions.text: Complete the analogy: Cat is to meow as dog is to ____.
questions.explanation: A cat produces a meow sound, and a dog produces a bark sound, following the animal-to-sound relationship.

questions.text: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: He is ____ than his brother.
questions.explanation: 'Taller' is the comparative form of 'tall,' used to compare two people.

questions.text: Identify the error in the sentence: She don’t like to read books.
questions.explanation: The verb 'don’t' should be 'doesn’t' to agree with the singular subject 'She' in present tense.

questions.text: What is the meaning of the word 'diligent'?
questions.explanation: 'Diligent' means showing persistent effort and care in one’s work.

questions.text: Choose the synonym for 'calm'.
questions.explanation: 'Calm' means free from agitation, and 'peaceful' is a synonym with a similar meaning.

questions.text: Choose the antonym for 'strong'.
questions.explanation: 'Strong' means having power or force, and 'weak' is its opposite, meaning lacking strength.

questions.text: Complete the analogy: Book is to read as piano is to ____.
questions.explanation: A book is used to read, and a piano is used to play, following the object-to-action relationship.

questions.text: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: The children ____ playing in the park.
questions.explanation: 'Are' is the present tense verb that agrees with the plural subject 'children'.

questions.text: Identify the error in the sentence: Me and my friend is going to the movie.
questions.explanation: 'Me' should be 'I' as the subject of the sentence. Additionally, 'is' should be 'are' for the plural subject, but the question focuses on one error.

questions.text: What is the meaning of the word 'vivid'?
questions.explanation: 'Vivid' means strikingly bright or clear, often used for colors or memories.

questions.text: Choose the synonym for 'smart'.
questions.explanation: 'Smart' means having quick intelligence, and 'intelligent' is a synonym with a similar meaning.

questions.text: Choose the antonym for 'open'.
questions.explanation: 'Open' means accessible or uncovered, and 'closed' is its opposite, meaning shut or blocked.

questions.text: Complete the analogy: Sun is to day as moon is to ____.
questions.explanation: The sun is associated with day (when it shines), and the moon is associated with night (when it is visible).

questions.text: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: This is the ____ book I have ever read.
questions.explanation: 'Best' is the superlative form of 'good,' used to indicate the highest quality among all books.

questions.text: Identify the error in the sentence: The dog chased it’s tail.
questions.explanation: 'It’s' should be 'its' (possessive pronoun) as 'it’s' means 'it is' or 'it has'.

questions.text: What is the meaning of the word 'ambiguous'?
questions.explanation: 'Ambiguous' means open to more than one interpretation, often unclear.

questions.text: Choose the synonym for 'brave'.
questions.explanation: 'Brave' means showing courage, and 'courageous' is a synonym with a similar meaning.

questions.text: Choose the antonym for 'ancient'.
questions.explanation: 'Ancient' means very old, and 'modern' is its opposite, meaning current or new.

questions.text: Complete the analogy: Teacher is to classroom as chef is to ____.
questions.explanation: A teacher works in a classroom, and a chef works in a kitchen, following the profession-to-workplace relationship.

questions.text: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: I have two cats, and ____ are very playful.
questions.explanation: 'They' is the correct subject pronoun for the plural noun 'cats' in this sentence.

questions.text: Identify the error in the sentence: The team plays good in every match.
questions.explanation: 'Good' should be 'well,' an adverb modifying the verb 'plays' to describe how the team performs.

questions.text: What is the meaning of the word 'eloquent'?
questions.explanation: 'Eloquent' means fluent and persuasive in speaking or writing.

questions.text: Choose the synonym for 'tired'.
questions.explanation: 'Tired' means lacking energy, and 'exhausted' is a synonym indicating extreme fatigue.

questions.text: Choose the antonym for 'polite'.
questions.explanation: 'Polite' means showing good manners, and 'rude' is its opposite, meaning discourteous.

questions.text: Complete the analogy: Bird is to fly as fish is to ____.
questions.explanation: A bird moves by flying, and a fish moves by swimming, following the animal-to-movement relationship.

questions.text: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: The movie was so ____ that I cried.
questions.explanation: 'Sad' is the adjective that logically fits, as it explains why the movie caused crying.
